intro: Claytonia parviflora subsp. parviflora, commonly known as the common spring beauty, is a herbaceous perennial native to North America. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. The plant features rosettes of glossy, oval-shaped leaves and produces clusters of small, white or pinkish flowers in early spring. Its botanical characteristics include a taproot system and showy, bell-shaped blooms that attract pollinators. It is often found in the eastern United States and is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role.
